segment.source: Learn how to add basic touch controls to your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) C++ game with DirectX.
segment.target: Learn how to add basic touch controls to your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) C++ game with DirectX.

segment.source: We show you how to add touch-based controls to move a fixed-plane camera in a Direct3D environment, where dragging with a finger or stylus shifts the camera perspective.
segment.target: We show you how to add touch-based controls to move a fixed-plane camera in a Direct3D environment, where dragging with a finger or stylus shifts the camera perspective.

segment.source: You can incorporate these controls in games where you want the player to drag to scroll or pan over a 3D environment, such as a map or playfield.
segment.target: You can incorporate these controls in games where you want the player to drag to scroll or pan over a 3D environment, such as a map or playfield.

segment.source: For example, in a strategy or puzzle game, you can use these controls to let the player view a game environment that is larger than the screen by panning left or right.
segment.target: For example, in a strategy or puzzle game, you can use these controls to let the player view a game environment that is larger than the screen by panning left or right.

segment.source: Note Our code also works with mouse-based panning controls.
segment.target: Note Our code also works with mouse-based panning controls.
